articles.title: About me
articles.description: I'm an assistant professor at [LEDa, Université Paris-Dauphine](https://leda.dauphine.fr/) in Paris, France. I work on **economics relevant to climate change**. In particular, I am interested in estimating climate change impacts, assessing adaptation options and designing optimal mitigation policies, mostly by using applied modeling tools. I co-organize the [Dauphine economics seminar](https://leda.dauphine.fr/fr/seminaire-externe/seminaire-leda.html).
articles.contents:
Employment and education
2022- Assistant professor at LEDa, Université Paris-Dauphine

2017-2021 PhD candidate at Paris-Saclay Applied Economics (PSAE). Advisor: Stéphane De Cara
2017-2021 Assistant lecturer at ENS Paris-Saclay.
2016-2017 Visiting student at Motu (Wellington, New Zealand).
2015-2016 Master 2, Université Paris Saclay, Economie de l’énergie de l’environnement et des transports.

articles.title: Research
articles.description:
**Research interests:** Agricultural economics, environmental economics, and climate change related issues (impacts, adaptation and mitigation)

**Tools:** Applied modeling, industrial organization models, microeconomic models, systematic literature review
